ITC Limited REPORT AND ACCOUNTS 2013

ITC's Brands: An Asset for the Nation

The consumer needs and aspirations they fulfil, the benefit they generate for millions across ITC's value chains, the future-ready capabilities that support them, and the value that they create for the country, have made ITC's brands national assets, adding to India's competitiveness.

It is ITC's aspiration to be the No 1 FMCG player in the country, driven by its new FMCG businesses. A recent Nielsen report has highlighted that ITC's new FMCG businesses are the fastest growing among the top consumer goods companies operating in India. ITC takes justifiable pride that, along with generating economic value, these celebrated Indian brands also drive the creation of larger societal capital through the virtuous cycle of sustainable and inclusive growth.

V. SUSTAINABILITY COMMITTEE

The role of the Sustainability Committee is to review, monitor and provide strategic direction to the Company's sustainability practices towards fulfilling its triple bottom line objectives. The Committee seeks to guide the Company in integrating its social and environmental objectives with its business strategies.

Composition

The Sustainability Committee presently comprises the Chairman of the Company and six Non-Executive Directors, four of whom are Independent Directors. The Chairman of the Chairman of the Committee.

The names of the members of the Sustainability Committee, including its Chairman, are provided under the section 'Board of Directors and Committees' in the Report and Accounts.

Meetings and Attendance

During the financial year ended 31st March, 2013, three meetings of the Sustainability Committee were held, as follows:

Sl. No. | Date | Committee Strength | No. of Members present
1 | 9th April, 2012 | 6 | 6
2 | 24th May, 2012 | 6 | 6
3 | 26th March, 2013 | 7 | 7

CORPORATE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE

The primary role of the Corporate Management Committee is strategic management of the Company's businesses within Board approved direction / framework.

Composition

The Corporate Management Committee presently comprises all the Executive Directors and six senior members of management. The Chairman of the Company is the Chairman of the Committee. The composition of the Corporate Management Committee is determined by the Board based on the recommendation of the Nominations Committee.

"The structure, processes and practices of governance are designed to support effective management of multiple businesses while retaining focus on each one of them."

Social Media Platform Cheat Sheet

[Pinterest logo]
Pinterest

Key differentiating trait:
More of a niche platform, despite very large usage. Great for businesses that involve planning, design, creation, making. Heavily female audience.

Best for:
Link clicks

Resource and expertise level needed:
High

Good for these business types:
Restaurants | Interior design | Wedding venues

---

[Twitter logo]
Twitter

Key differentiating trait:
Fast-moving, real-time, news-driven platform. Strong customer service element, be prepared to engage and respond to customers here.

Best for:
Link clicks, engagement, and foot traffic

Resource and expertise level needed:
Low

Good for these business types:
Retail | Nonprofits | Newspapers & media outlets

---

[LinkedIn logo]
LinkedIn

Key differentiating trait:
Unlike almost every other platform, which is designed for the user to focus on their personal interests, this is a profession-driven platform.

Best for:
Link clicks, event registrations

Resource and expertise level needed:
Medium

Good for these business types:
Luxury goods & services | Software providers | B2B Companies

---

[Instagram logo]
Instagram

Key differentiating trait:
There are very few ways to link from Instagram, so this is a brand-building platform. You need to have lots of high-quality images and videos to support this platform.

Best for:
Foot traffic, word-of-mouth awareness, engagement

Resource and expertise level needed:
Medium to high

Good for these business types:
Bakeries & Coffee Shops | Travel agencies | Art museums

---

[Facebook logo]
Facebook

Key differentiating trait:
This is the platform, but it doesn't mean you need to be there. With the recent challenges the platform has faced, some users are choosing to spend their social media time elsewhere (like Instagram, which is also a Facebook platform). That being said, there's still no better place to find and engage customers, donors, or others.

Best for:
Link clicks, word-of-mouth awareness, event registrations

Resource and expertise level needed:
Low

Good for these business types:
Local Brick & Mortar Stores | Nonprofits | B2B Companies

Constant Contact

THE HISTORY of social media

[Icons shown: Friendster, Wordpress, Tumblr, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram]

Social media channels seem to be everywhere and with 135 minutes of our time spent on social media platforms every day, it's crazy to think that it's only been 20 years since the first social media site was made. Without any further ado, here we have the history of social media!

THE BEGINNING - 1844
Samuel Morse made the first step towards some resemblance of social media when he sent a telegram from Washington D.C. to Baltimore. Morse's first message read "What Hath God Wrought?"

MILITARY'S FIRST SOCIAL MEDIA ATTEMPT - 1969
ARPA (Advanced Research Projects Agency Network) wanted to connect Universities on a proto-internet. It worked great...if you worked in the military. Unfortunately, the letters 'U' weren't the complete 'LOGIN' that they had planned to send over.

START OF SOCIAL SITES - 1997
From 1997 to 2001, Six Degrees had a peak of about 1 million members who were able to create profiles and 'friend' each other.

CREATIVITY AND STATUS BLOGS - 1999
LiveJournal was a platform where users could blog as a form of keeping friends updated with their lives. A format later used by Facebook for their 'status'.

A CHALLENGER EMERGES - 2002
Friendster, one of the first social media sites, is created and launched by Peter Chin, Jonathan Abrams, and Dave Lee. Within the first three months, Friendster had three million users and turned down a $30 million buyout from Google, widely considered one of the biggest blunders of Silicon Valley.

LINK UP WITH BUSINESSES - 2003
LinkedIn gives users a place to post their resume and private message people with a paid feature. LinkedIn is still a popular way for businesses to scout for new employees and for users to search for jobs. By 2007, the social network for jobs would reach 1 million. 13 years later they would break 500 million users.

GMAIL RECEIVED - 2004
Google enters the communications space, Gmail. In the UK Gmail was branded as Google Mail due to naming disputes. This lasted until 2009 when they changed the branding back after the dispute was over.

FACEBOOK BEGINS - 2004
In February 2004, Facebook was launched by Mark Zuckerberg, along with his Harvard roommates. The site was initially limited to Harvard students then was expanded to other universities and over years, this membership would be worldwide and number of users grew to around 2.2 billion in 14 years.

BIRTH OF YOUTUBE - 2005
YouTube, a platform on which users can upload and share videos, was made public in February 2005. The first video to hit 1m million views also came within this year thanks to a Nike advert featuring Ronaldinho.

Facebook is now made available in the UK, Ireland, Canada, Australia and New Zealand on October 1st.

MYSPACE IS BOOMING - 2006
Myspace became the most popular social network in the US during 2006! That's just 3 years after it was founded.

Twitter is launched publically on July 15th.

750 TWEETS PER SECOND! - 2010
65 million tweets a day are being sent out on Twitter, that's around 750 tweets every second.

LAUNCH OF SNAPCHAT - 2013
Snapchat, an image messaging app, is launched in September after being tested as 'Picaboo' in July 2011. One of the founding members is pushed out before Snapchat is released.

SHORT VIDEOS, MEGA VIEWS - 2013
Vine, a video hosting service specializing in short videos, goes public in June. Twitter acquires Vine for $30 million in the October of that year.

UK'S INSTA ADS - 2014
Instagram brings sponsored Ads to target the UK in September following their inclusion on the app in America.

LIFE OF A STARMAN - 2015
NASA's #YearInSpace hashtag, giving Twitter followers updates on Scott Kelly an astronaut who lived in space for a year!

VR AND FAKE NEWS - 2018
Virtual Reality, live videos, and 360-degree videos replace all video content on social media as the 'new' form of social media. There was a crackdown on fake news throughout social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter.

After all of this, we now have a beautiful array of social media channels to pick and choose from. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat and more. We wonder what next advancement social media creators will think up, what do you think will happen in the future world of social media?

www.redgiraffe.uk

Social Media Security

The explosion of Facebook and social media has created a whole new set of security problems.

Social Media Growth
Growth in Social Media Users 2008-2013

Facebook: Over 200,000,000 Facebook account grew from 100 million in 2008 to 1.1 billion by 2013
Twitter: 200 million - Twitter jumped to 200 million users in 2013
Instagram: From 2010-2013 Instagram amassed 150 million users
Pinterest: 2010-2013: Pinterest went from 0 to 70 million users
LinkedIn: LinkedIn has grown to over 200 million users

In One Internet Minute...
00:00:00

[Clock showing: 00:45:00 - LinkedIn: 100 job applications; 00:15:00 - Twitter: 100,000 new tweets]

00:30:00

Warning Signs
No Account is Safe!

6 million - LinkedIn passwords compromised
500 Thousand - Scribd passwords stolen
450 Thousand - Yahoo passwords compromised

Data Breaches
In 2012 - 2013

Fake Profiles, Social Trust Exploitation, Short URLs and other ways we're being taken advantage of on Social Media.

7.2 % of Social Media Profiles were Fake in Q1 2013!
- Duplicate accounts
- Spammer profiles
- Profiles created by other automated programs to send spam

The Facebook Dislike Button Scam
All of these scams offered to add a new Dislike Button feature to the user's account. Instead, it attempted Install malware.

84% of malicious links submitted by Sophos researchers in the U.S. & UK, of redirecting sites were accepted

TRANSFORMATION RATE: VIRUS-DOWNLOADER → SAFE HITS

We're Part of the Problem

Not Properly Using or Under-Utilizing Social Media Privacy Settings

10% of Social Media users claim that at some point they have had their identity hacked
30% of Social Media users use NO PRIVACY controls on their profiles at all
39% of Social Media users post updates and profiles on company or employer

Oversharing, Annoying to Friends: A Treasure Trove for Identity Thieves.

My name is RICHARD SMITH
I was born MAY 6, 1984
I live at 3205 STEALMY IDENTITY ST.
MY BEST FRIEND'S name is HI AND I'M A STRANGER?

The damage that can be done with just TWO pieces of information is incredible.

Sharing Malicious Links
Jaylee Chan & David Frost - One Example of a Malicious Facebook Story Link evolution:

"I'm Floored!" → 1 Friend → 1 post → 4 minutes → Android Apps

Own Your Digital Identity

How to Protect Yourself When Using Social Media

Create one and one longer passwords with numbers, upper/lower case letters, and special characters. Passwords can be the only key to your key!

Use a reliable and secure anti-virus across all of your computers and web connected devices.

Backup your most important information. If the worst happens you can restore your data it you have a backup. However, the data only stays safe if the virus doesn't steal on your computer as well.
